data.title: List of Die Hard Scenario Films and Shows
authors: Contributors to Die Hard scenario Wiki
data.meta_description: This is a detailed list of all the Die Hard Scenario movies and TV shows out there. For a list of actors who appeared in these films and shows, see here. For a list of the Die Hard scenario filmmakers, see here. Some of these filmmakers were also primarily inspired by Steven E. de Souza's...
data.text:
This is a detailed list of all the Die Hard Scenario movies and TV shows out there. For a list of actors who appeared in these films and shows, see here.

For a list of the Die Hard scenario filmmakers, see here. Some of these filmmakers were also primarily inspired by Steven E. de Souza's material for the first Die Hard film as well as his script work for 1985's Commando. Please also note that some of these Die Hard Scenario films might be far more inspired by its sequels, or the various similar films (High Noon, Runaway Train, Game of Death, Dog Day Afternoon, Airport, The Towering Inferno, The Bullet Train, Speed, The Fugitive, Reservoir Dogs, Cliffhanger, Broken Arrow, The Rock, Executive Decision, Man on Fire, Hard Boiled, Enemy of the State, Taken, Mission: Impossible, Buried, 24, The Unit, Spooks, Panic Room, Tom Clancy adaptations and either version of The Desperate Hours, The Taking of Pelham One Two Three or Assault on Precinct 13) rather than the original 1988 Die Hard film.

For a list of Die Hard-type video games, see here.

For a list of comparisons between the Die Hard and James Bond film series, see here.

For a list of films that pre-dated and inspired several Die Hard-type films, see here.

For TV shows that had single or multiple episodes that referenced the Die Hard formula, see here.

This list is incomplete. You can help us by expanding it.

List[]

1-100[]

2:22

2 Guns [1] [2] [3]

3 Days to Kill: A 2014 Luc Besson action-comedy directed by McG and which has much of the same material found in A Good Day to Die Hard, the James Bond films, Mr. and Mrs. Smith and Taken films. [4] [5] [6] [7] [8]

3 Ninjas: High Noon At Mega Mountain

4.3.2.1. [9] [10] [11] [12] [13]

6 Bullets [14]

The 6th Day

7 Minutes [15] [16]

12 Rounds

12 Rounds: Reloaded

12 Rounds 3: Lockdown (Originally titled Lockdown): A police officer is trapped inside his own precinct by renegade police officers trying to dispose of any incriminating evidence against them.[17] [18] [19] [20]

15 Minutes [21] [22] [23] [24]

16 Blocks [25]

16 December

22 Bullets [26] [27] [28] [29] [30]

24 [31]

24 Hrs: Another Bollywood action thriller.

24: India

24: Live Another Day

24: Redemption

24 XXX: An Axel Braun Parody

30 Days of Night [32]

30 Minutes or Less

80 Minutes [33]

88 Minutes: D.O.A. meets Nick of Time meets "24" all in a confined area much like Die Hard with a Vengeance. [34]

A[]

The A-Team (2010 film) [35]

A Bittersweet Life [36] [37]

A Common Man: A 2013 remake of the hit film A Wednesday!

A Good Day to Die Hard: John McClane travels to Russia to help his son John Jr., only to discover that he is a CIA operative out to stop Russian terrorists from confiscating weapons-grade uranium.

A Holiday Heist: 2011 television film loosely in the style of Home Alone and Die Hard.

A Lonely Place to Die [38] [39]

A Man Apart [40] [41] [42]

A Wing and a Prayer (1998 television movie)

A Wednesday!

A Monster with a Thousand Heads (A.K.A. Un monstruo de mil cabezas) [43]

A New Wave [44]

Abduction (2011) [45] [46]

Ablaze: Another firefighter action film set in a building a la Backdraft.

Act of Valor [47] [48]

Act of War

Active Stealth [49]

Acts of Betrayal: 1997 action film which has a Assault on Precinct 13 sort of feel and even pre-dates Panic Room in a way; Also has a group of assassins disguising themselves as thieves so basically a counter to the whole Hans Gruber and his goon's cover story about them being out to rob a place.

Against the Dark

Age of Dinosaurs: Another mockbuster from The Asylum which steals scenes from Die Hard and Jurassic Park.

Age of Kill [50] [51]

Agent Red

The Aggression Scale: Home Alone-meets-Die Hard.

Air Collision

Air Force One: President James Marshall takes on Russian terrorists who hijacked Air Force One and hold the president's family and passengers hostage.

Air Force Two [52]

Air Marshal

Air Panic (A.K.A. Panic)

Air Rage

Airborne: Sounding extremely similar to Broken Arrow and advertised as being the next Turbulence and Executive Decision, this action thriller finds a group of thieves trying to smuggle in a stolen nuclear weapon via plane with a bunch of federal agents being the only ones capable of stopping the villain's efforts.

Airboss

Airboss II: Preemptive Strike

Airboss III: The Payback

Airboss IV: The X Factor

Airheads

Airline Disaster

Airplane vs Volcano

Airspeed

Alan Partridge

Alien Raiders: Die Hard/Dog Day Afternon-meets-They Live. [61] [62] [63] [64]

Almost Human [65] [66] [67]

Along Came a Spider [68] [69] [70]

The Alternate: Another "save the President" scenario movie.

The American

American Heist [72] [73]

American Meltdown (A.K.A. Meltdown)

April Rain

Arctic Blue [78]

Armed for Action

Armstrong

The Art of War II: Betrayal [90]

The Art of War III: Retribution [91]

Assassins [92] [93] [94] [95]

The Assault: Another low-rent Jim Wynorski in the style of Die Hard and Assault on Precinct 13.

Assault on Dome 4: In this SciFi Channel Original movie, an escaped prisoner holds various captives hostage on-board a space station.

Assault on Precinct 13 (2005 film): Police officers and imprisoned criminals must fight to survive when corrupt, disgruntled cops surround the station with the intent of killing all inside. Despite being intended as a remake, the director and his crew (who also made 2002's The Nest) have assembled a film that quite often also resembles elements of the Die Hard franchise. [100]

Athena: Goddess of War: Spin-off series of Iris.

Athena: Goddess of War: The Movie: Edited movie version of the aforementioned series.

ATM: Another thriller from the writer of Buried. [101] [102] [103] [104] [105]

Atomic Eden [106] [107] [108]

Atomic Train [109]

Attack the Block

Aurora: Operation Intercept

Automatic

Avengers: Age of Ultron [110] [111] [112] [113]

Awaken (2015) [114]

Awarapan: Remake of 2005's A Bittersweet Life.

Awarapan 2: Upcoming sequel to the original Awarapan.

B[]

Baadshah: Bollywood film that's a combination of Nick of Time, If Looks Could Kill, the Jackie Chan film Rush Hour and The Mask.

Baazi: A 1995 Bollywood film that steals entire segments and plot points from 1983's Scarface, 1988's Die Hard and 1991's The Hard Way.

Baby (2015)

Backdraft

Badal: 2000 Bollywood thriller heavily inspired by the plot line for 1997's The Devil's Own

Badges of Fury [115] [116]

Bait

Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever [117]

Ballistica is filled with action, action and another action! Tough and deadly hand to hand combat with various firearms, Paul Logan stars as the CIA's best weapon against international terrorism. This film is a tough action movie in the style of Die Hard, Commando and 12 Rounds!

Bandits [118] [119]

Bang Bang!: Bollywood remake of Knight and Day.

Bangkok Dangerous (1999)

Behind Enemy Lines: Columbia

Behind Enemy Lines II: Axis of Evil

Below Utopia

The Berlin File: Mash-up of Swiri, Die Hard and The Bourne Identity franchise.

Best of the Best 4: Without Warning [124]

Best Men [125]

Beverly Hills Cop III: The third installment of the franchise is often described by the original two Die Hard film's writer (who also penned this film) as being "Die Hard in a theme park."

Beyond Rangoon [126]

Bichhoo: 2000 remake of Léon: The Professional.

Big Bullet: 1996 action-crime film about special police unit stopping criminals from committing robberies and hijacking a plane with weapons. The finale is much akin to Die Hard 2.

Big Game

The Big Hit [127]

Black Dog

Black Horizon: Another trapped on a satellite that's been set out of control by terrorists by Steve Latshaw, who also wrote Memorial Day and Scorpio One. [128] [129]

Black Mask [130]

Black Mask 2: City of Masks [131] [132]

Black Sea

Black Thunder

The Blacklist

The Blacksheep Affair (A.K.A. Another Meltdown): 1998 so-bad-it's-good turkey that was packaged in the US as a unrelated sequel to 1995's High Risk (A.K.A. Meltdown).

Blast (1997): Terrorists take over a gymnasium and hold various Olympic hopefuls hostage until a disgruntled detective with a bizarre haircut arrives with the most unlikely solution.

Blast (2004)

Brake: a troubled yet devout Secret Service agent is trapped in the trunk of a car and physically and psychologically tortured by terrorists seeking information about the President of the United States' whereabouts.

Breakdown [157]: An action thriller with elements of Deliverance, Die Hard, The River Wild and either version of The Vanishing.

Breaking News: In this Johnny To Hong Kong action thriller, this formula comes off as "Die Hard-in-an-apartment-complex" with some cat-and-mouse intrigue laden here as well.

Brick Mansions: Remake of District B13.

Britz [158]

Broken Arrow: USAF pilot Captain Riley Hale and park ranger Terry Carmichael battle Hale's mentor Major Vic Deakins and his group of rogue military operatives who stole 2 nuclear weapons from a stealth bomber on a desert.

Bullet (2014 film) [159] [160] [161] [162] [163] [164] [165] [166]

Bullet to the Head [167] [168] [169]

Champion: 2000 film which rips off Mercury Rising and The Bodyguard.

Chill Factor: Another Die Hard clone similar to Speed and Broken Arrow

Christmas Rush (A.K.A. Breakaway): In this TBS original movie, the storyline revolves around a detective (played by Dean Cain) who arrives to take out some jewel thieves who have taken over a shopping mall and taking the detective's spouse hostage.

"Chuck" [191] [192] [193] [194] [195]

City Hunter: Another film where terrorists take over a cruise ship. Jackie Chan and Gary Daniels star.

Civilian- upcoming Jackie Chan film which is described by the creators as "Die hard-in-a-NRA-type-weapons-convention". [196]

Cleanskin [197]

Clear and Present Danger: Another pre-dated Die Hard scenario novel loosely adapted in post-Die Hard world.

Cliffhanger: Troubled ex-mountain rescue climber Gabe Walker confronts international terrorists who force him and others to find 3 suitcases of stolen money in the Colorado Rocky Mountains.

Con Air: Imprisoned ex-Army Ranger Cameron Poe battles violent convicts who hijacked a prison transport jet.

Con Express: Another Broken Arrow and Under Siege 2 clone with stock footage taken from 1993's Cliffhanger.

Connected: 2008 Chinese thriller that remakes Cellular.

Contagion (2011) [212]

Contraband [213] [214] [215]

The Courier [220] [221] [222] [223] [224]

Crackerjack: Troubled Chicago policeman Jack Wild battles terrorist leader Ivan Getz and his gang at a mountainside hotel resort.

Crackerjack 2 (A.K.A. Hostage Train): Another Under Siege 2: Dark Territory clone.

Crackerjack 3: Second unrelated sequel to 1994's Crackerjack.

Cradle 2 the Grave [225]

Crank

Crank 2: High Voltage

Crash Dive

Crash Landing

Crash Point: Berlin

The Crew (1994)

Crimson Tide: While the film itself isn't directly influenced by Die Hard, it does take a cue from other mutiny-at-sea and underwater disaster films including The Caine Mutiny and The Hunt for Red October. [227] [228]

Crisis (1997 film)

Crisis (2014 TV series)

Critical Mass: A German terrorist group takes over a factory with an off-duty security guard being the only thing standing in their way in another archive-footage laden film courtesy of director Fred Olen Ray.

Crocodile Hunter (A.K.A. Juen diu daai ngok): [229]

Crossfire: 1998 independent film where a group of terrorists attempt to destroy the Statue of Liberty.

Counter Measures

Counterstrike

"CSI: Cyber" [230] [231]

"CSI: Miami" [232]

"CSI: New York" [233]

The Cutter

Cyberjack (A.K.A. Virtual Assassin)

D[]

Damned River [237]

Danger Beneath the Sea: 2002 telefilm clearly influenced by Crimson Tide and The Hunt for Red October among other low-budget submarine film productions. [238]

Danger Zone [239]

Dante's Peak: Another enclosed disaster film by Leslie Bohem, the writer of 1996's Daylight. [240] [241] [242]

Dark Descent: Another Outland clone, which itself was a clone of the High Noon formula.

The Dark Knight: While the film has been known to be compared to 1995's Heat, others have interpreted it as also containing shout-outs to films much like Se7en, Speed and Die Hard 3 [243][244] [245] [246] [247]

The Dark Knight Rises [248] [249] [250] [251] [252]

http://bollywoodnewsflash.com/dark-prince-the-true-story-of-dracula-a-review/

Daylight [253]

Dead Calm

Dead End City: 1988 film released post-Die Hard that plays as a derivative mash-up of Assault on Precinct 13 and Escape from N.Y. [254]

Dead Fire: a film that pre-dates Lockout revolving around scientists and a spaceship crew battling a gang of criminals on a space station.

Dead in a Heartbeat

Dead in the Water [255]

Dead Man Down [256] [257]

Dead Man's Trigger: Online web series with Hassan Johnson as a man racing against time to stop a bomb from going off in this one season series.

Dead Men Can't Dance [258]

Dead Presidents [259] [260]

The Deadliest Lesson (2008) [261]

Deadlocked: Another thriller similar to The Negotiator.

Deadly Heroes: A rather low-budget Die Hard 2-type rip-off that went straight to video.

Deadly Ransom

Death, Deceit & Destiny Aboard the Orient Express

Death Machine: Another low-budget film with segments taken from Die Hard and Alien.

Death Squad: An all-star B-movie cast join a 2014 futuristic concept that's a cash-in on The Expendables franchise.

Death Train (2003)

Death Train (2006)

Deadfall (2012 film)

Deadline: Sirf 24 Ghante: Bollywood remake of Trapped (2002 film).

Deadly Impact

Deadly Outbreak: Sergeant Dutton Hatfield is pitted against terrorist leader Colonel Baron and his men who have taken over a chemical plant in Tel Aviv.

Death Ring

Deep Rising

Default: Another low-budget plane hijacking thriller but this time done in the found-footage style. [262]

The Defender (2004) [263]

Deja Vu: Back to the Future meets Die Hard.

Delta Force 2: The Colombian Connection

Delta Force 3: The Killing Game

Delta Force One: The Lost Patrol

Demolition High

Demolition Man [264] [265] [266] [267] [268] [269] [270]

Demolition University

Den D: 2008 remake of 1985's Commando and better known as Russian Commando.

The Departed [271] [272] [273] [274] [275]

Depth Charge

Derailed: NATO operative Jacques Kristoff battles terrorists who hijacked an passenger train to search and steal a weaponized, ultra-virulent strain of smallpox.

Desert Thunder

Desperado [276] [277] [278]

Desperate Hours (1990 remake) [279]

Desperate Measures

Detention

Detonator (1993 Pierce Brosnan film) (A.K.A. Alistair MacNeill's "Death Train")

Detonator (2003)

The Detonator [280] (2006 Wesley Snipes film)

Detonator II: Nightwatch

The Devil's Own

Dhoom 2: Remake of Day of the Jackal (1973), Mission: Impossible II (2000) and Payback (1999). Scenes are copied from After the Sunset (2004), The Thomas Crown Affair (1999), xXx (2003) and Entrapment (1999) with touches of Shalimaar (1978).

Diamondbacks [281]

Die Another Day [282] [283] [284]

Die Hard: Off-duty New York cop John McClane battles German radical Hans Gruber and his internationally based group who seize control of Nakatomi Plaza on Christmas Eve.

Die Hard 2: Die Harder: John McClane battles renegade ex-military commandos who took control of Dulles International Airport.

Die Hard with a Vengeance: John McClane and shopkeeper Zeus Carver tried to find terrorist mastermind Simon Gruber and his men who is setting bombs in New York to distract them from their own agenda.

Die Hardest

Diplomatic Siege: The Romanian embassy is taken over by terrorists and it's up to a bomb expert to stop them.

Direct Contact [285]

Dirty

Dirty War

Disaster Zone: Volcano in New York: Low-budgeted 2006 telefilm clearly inspired by 1997's Volcano.

District B13- Mash-up of elements from Die Hard and Assault on Precinct 13 as well as Transporter and Escape from New York.

District B13: Ultimatum

Don't Die Too Hard!: French parody of the general Die Hard premise.

Don't Say a Word [286] [287] [288]

Doom: 2005 adaptation of the popular video game that bares far more resemblance to Predator, Aliens, Ghosts of Mars, Deep Rising and Starship Troopers with mild shades of Die Hard and Event Horizon. [289] [290]

The Double: A 2011 action thriller in the style of Jason Bourne and the Taken franchise.

Double Deception [291]

Double Face: Sen'nyû sôsa hen (2012): Japanese telefilm remake of Infernal Affairs.

Double Identity [292] [293] [294]

Dragon Fighter: A mishmash of Reign of Fire, Aliens, "24", Jurassic Park and other Die Hard type elements.

Dredd: Judge Dredd and his rookie partner Judge Anderson are trapped in the 200-story building owned by homicidal drug lord Madeline "Ma-Ma" Madrigal and her gang.

Drive Hard [295]

Driven to Kill [296]

Drop Zone

Dus

Dying of the Light [297] [298] [299]

E[]

E-Ring

Eagle Eye [300]

Echelon Conspiracy: Another cyber thriller in the vein of Live Free or Die Hard, Eagle Eye, Enemy of the State, The Net and TV's "24".

Edge of Darkness (2010) [301] [302]

Edge of Tomorrow [303] [304] [305] [306] [307]

Edison Force [308]

Ek Ajnabee: Bollywood remake of 2004's Man on Fire.

El Gringo

The Elite

The Employer [314]

End Game (2006 film)

Enemy Action

Enemy of the State [315] [316]

Enemies Closer [317] [318]

Entrapment [319] [320] [321] [322] [323] [324]

The Equalizer: 2014 loose rehash of the popular 80s television show with a finale that's very influenced by the Die Hard and High Noon formula. Directed by Olympus Has Fallen's Antoine Fuqua. [325] [326]

Epicenter: Low-budget Towering Inferno type adventure-disaster film which also borrows stock footage from blockbuster films such as Speed, Money Train and Metro.

Eraser [327] [328] [329] [330] [331] [332] [333] [334]

Erased [335]

Escape from L.A.

Escape Plan: Another contained "Die Hard-in-a-prison" in the style of Half Past Dead. [336] [337][338]

Escape Under Pressure (A.K.A. The Cruel Deep)

Evasive Action: A train transporting highly dangerous prisoners is taken hostage when the main prisoner leader manages to help his crew break out of their cell and take the train hostage. One of the prisoners, a wrongly-convicted man, ends up sheltering on the train and realizes his wife and child are on the same transport. He makes all efforts to take out the terrorists one-by-one while saving his family.

Everly

Executive Decision: Anti-terrorist expert Dr. David Grant and a team of Special Forces operatives board an 747 airliner that was hijacked by Islamic terrorists.

Executive Target: Another Die Hard with a Vengeance clone, this time involving the kidnapping of the president by an ex-con who's family is threatened by an underground terrorist circuit. It's up to our hero Michael Madsen to turn the tables on the masterminds behind the deadly chaos.

Exit Speed: Bus passengers must fight to survive when a group of meth-addicted, vengeful bikers surround it and attack.

The Expendables

The Expendables (TV show)

The Expendables 2

The Expendables 3

The Expendables 4

Extraction: A US Soldier is tasked with extracting a prisoner from a maximum-security Chechen prison.

Extraction (2016 Bruce Willis film) [339] [340]

Extreme Crisis (A.K.A. B gai waak)

Extreme Ops [341]: This does have several Cliffhanger and Vertical Limit type moments just with snowboarders and terrorists instead of rock climbers and thieves.

Eye of the Widow

F[]

Face of Terror

Face/Off [342]

Falcon Down: A SciFi-enhanced version of Broken Arrow/Firefox that involves submarines and more silly special effects.

Fallout: Die Hard on a NASA space station

Family Under Siege (A.K.A. Dynamite) 2004 hostage drama-thriller.

Fast Five [343] [344] [345] [346] [347]

Faster [348] [349]

The Fifth Commandment [350] [351] [352] [353]

The Fifth Element: The second portion of the film has a hostage scenario set aboard an outer space cruise ship.

Final Voyage

Fire Down Below

Fire with Fire

Firefight (2003 film)

Firestorm: Smokejumper Jesse Graves takes on escaped convicts led by Randall Shaye, who have kidnapped bird watcher Jennifer, in the midst of a raging forest fire. [358]

Firestorm (2013): 2013 action-crime thriller with Andy Lau.

Firetrap

Firewall: Ransom meets Swordfish with hints of Harrison Ford's typical attempt to rescue his wife and family scenario carried over from the likes of Patriot Games and Air Force One with Mary Lynn Rajskub playing a role much akin to her Chloe O'Brien character on 24.

First Daughter (1999 TV film)

First Shot: Second and last sequel to First Daughter.

First Target: First sequel to First Daughter.

Fist Power: Another Hong Kong actioner where a madman takes over a school. [359]

Flight of Fury: A rehash of the Broken Arrow/Firefox rip-off Black Thunder with stock footage from that film inserted and instead of starring Michael Dudikoff, this time it features Steven Seagal.

Flight of the Living Dead: Outbreak on a Plane: Another cult movie that is clearly a cash-in on the Snakes on a Plane formula.

Flightplan: An aircraft engineer hunts through the airliner she designed to find her missing daughter everyone denies ever existing while also trying to fight someone who wants her dead.

Flipped (2015 film) [360]

Flypaper (2011 film) [361] [362] [363] [364] [365]

Force of Five (A.K.A. Power Kids)

Four Towers: Upcoming 2015 Die Hard rip-off starring Michael Dudikoff and Steven Seagal. [366]

The Fourth Angel [367] [368] [369] [370] [371] [372]

Freedom Strike

Free Fall (1999 film)

Free Fall (2014) film about a protagonist trapped in an elevator that echoes Panic Room and Die Hard.

Freezer: Die Hard in a freezing room.

From Paris With Love [376]
